intro: Calendula officinalis var. hydruntina, commonly known as the Hydruntina marigold, is a flowering plant belonging to the Asteraceae family. It is characterized by its bright orange to yellow petals and is native to the Mediterranean region. The plant typically grows to a height of about 30–60 cm, with hairy stems and broad, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers bloom in late summer to early autumn, and it is often cultivated for ornamental purposes as well as for its medicinal properties. The variety is noted for its hardiness and ability to thrive in a variety of soil conditions.
